result.execSummary:
The defendant Lacey C.A. Julian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 13CF345 and 15CF73 called together at 3:16pm [mo]
Defendant Lacey C.A. Julian in court, in custody with Attorney Brian Severson.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Severson verifies receipt of PSI; gives supplemental information as to Ms. Julian's education
--DA Happ makes a correction to a typographical error within the PSI, regarding reason for warrant issuance

Both parties verify receipt of letter from non party regarding sentencing
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Attorney Severson submits information on sober living facility
The Court seeks clarification of sentencing guidelines from Agent Brock, the author of PSI, who is present in the courtroom gallery
Ms. Julian reads and submits written statement to the Court

On Case 13CF345, Count #1:

The Court sentences Ms. Julian   to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH. 

As Conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $375 drug testing fees plus $300 buy money reimbursement plus $208.50 in subpoena fees plus extradition fees in an amount to be determined
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent and follow through as directed
--to submit DNA sample upon demand

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

On Case 15CF73, Count #1:
The Court withholds sentence and places Ms. Julian on Probation for 2 years, consecutive to 13CF345

Conditions of Probation: 
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--Payment of all court obligations and supervision fees 
--To maintain sobriety and not consume nor possess alcohol or illegal drugs 
--Report to Agent any prescribed medications and take all prescribed medications as ordered by treatment provider 
--Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections. 
--and any other conditions at the discretion of the Agent

On Case 13CF345: 
The Court gives  194   days credit for time already served.
On Case 15CF73: The Court gives  0   days credit for time already served.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 5:02pm
Letter from non-party re sentencing
Amended
Clerk's Note regarding DOB error on Order for PSI
Sentencing hearing at 08-18-2015 03:00 pm
Scheduling Notice
With Criminal Case Settlement from and JI's attached.

Cases 13CF345 and 15CF73 called at 9:38am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Lacey C.A. Julian in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Defendant Lacey C.A. Julian in custody.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Procedural and scheduling information addressed by the Court and Counsel.  Court establishes that the intent of the parties is to conduct the plea hearing today with the sentencing hearing being continued for another date/time. 

Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.
13CF345 - Count #1 -  Guilty  plea entered by the Defendant.
15CF73 - Count #1 - Guilty plea entered by  the Defendant.
Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea in each case.  Finds the Def. guilty as charged in Count #1 of each case and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered in each case.
State moves to read-in and dismiss Count #2 and Count #3 in both cases; so ordered by the Court. 
Victim rights compliance verified. 

Procedural and scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel.
Defense requests a PSI; presents basis. 
Court orders a PSI. 
At the request of the State, the Court will complete the PSI order indicating that the agent should appear.
Recess 9:53am. 

Next - (Notices to be mailed.) 
Sentencing Hearing - 8/18/15 at 3pm (1 1/2 hours needed.)
Plea hearing at 06-08-2015 09:30 am

Cases 13CF345 and 15CF73 called together at 10:17am [mo]
Defendant Lacey C.A. Julian in court, in custody with Attorney Brian Severson.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance in both files

The Court discloses to the parties that before hearing off record the Court spoke with Bob Dore, Mr. Dore began speaking of Ms. Julian and the Court ended the discussion, explaining it could only accept information through the courtroom.
Further the Court notes, that it has presided over other cases where Ms. Julian was a party.

As to the Defendant's 4/13/2015 Motions for Modification of Bond:
--DA Happ verifies receipt of Motions and attached letter from Hope Haven
--DA Happ opposes the Motions, gives explanation and arguments 
--Atty. Severson gives arguments; notes Ms. Julian has been partaking in NA while in custody.
--Atty Severson notes that he has recently learned,  that Bob Dore with a treatment facility will hold open a spot for Ms. Julian
--The Court questions Atty Severson as to the security of Hope Haven
--The Court denies the Defendant's Motions for Modification of Bond; each case. 


DA Happ requests the case 13CF345 Jury Trial dates be adjourned due to unavailability of testifying officers. 
--Attorney Severson does not take a position
--The previously scheduled Jury Trial and FSSC dates for 15CF73 are to now be used for the 13CF345 case, and shall the 13CF345 case resolve prior to the Jury date, then the dates are to be used for the 15CF73 case (if not yet resolved).

Attorney Severson orally motions to reduce the Cash Bail amount
--DA Happ has no further arguments
--Arguments from Atty Severson
--The Court denies the request/ oral motion to reduce the cash bail amount 

recess:10:51am  

NEXT: Case #13CF345: (1) FSSC: June 29, 2015 at 11:00am  (2) JURY TRIAL: July 2, 2015 at 8:30am
Motion hearing on May 4, 2015 at 10:15 am.
to Modify Bond, Defendant's (with attached Let. from non-party)

Cases 13CF345 and 15CF73 called at 10:09am [mo]
Defendant Lacey C.A. Julian in court, in custody,  with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek and Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court is presented with a susbtitution of attorney form, signed by all parties.
The Court approves the substitution of attorney request, and dismisses Atty. Svehlek from the case. 
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Severson indicates that he has recieved some Discovery from the State and intends to recieve additional Discovery later this week.
Atty. Severson requests that these cases be scheduled for Trial, further he requests one day Trial for each.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

Cases 13CF345 and 15CF73 called at 8:36 [mo]
Defendant Lacey C.A. Julian in court, in custody,  with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

In Case 15CF73 Ms. Julian waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Julian waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--The Court accepts Mr. Julian's pleas 


As to the status of case 13CF345 Atty. Svehlek indicates that she has recieved a proposed Criminal Case Settlement and would request a Status Conference out 2 weeks for both cases.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

NEXT: On both cases: Status Conference April 7,2015 at 10:00am
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
State's with Cover Letter
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice
03-16-2015  CASH BOND AMENDED TO ADD CASE #15CF73 & CONDITONS:

Case called at 2:08pm [mo]
Defendant Lacey C.A. Julian in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Svhelek indicates that Ms. Julian has a new matter that is set for an Initial Appearance [case 15CF73] and requests that the cases be set together.
The State verifies victim rights compliance.
After review of the case, the Court suggests the inital appearance of case 15CF73 be conducted at this time.
No objection from the State or Defense. 
  
INITIAL APPEARANCE CONDUCTED IN CASE 15CF73:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit

The Court orders that the $20,000 CASH Bond of case 13CF345 be applied to case 15CF73, with the added conditions to this single bond: 
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
--No Contact with Phillip Fay
recess :2:25pm
